Subject: Protein
Description: Allowed: 'pdb_code', 'pdb_filepath'.

Subject: Protein
Description: Either a valid PDB-code or a local filepath to a PDB-file

Subject: Ligand
Description: Allowed: 'smiles', 'cid', 'inchi', 'inchikey', 'iupac_name', 'name' (Note that 'name' and 'iupac_name' identifiers do not work for all compounds).

Subject: Ligand
Description: Identifier value corresponding to given input type, e.g. SMILES or CID number.

Subject: Binding Site
Description: Definition method for the protein binding site. Allowed: 'coordinates', 'ligand', 'detection'. Default: detection

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If Definition Method is 'coordinates', enter the coordinates here. The coordinates should be entered as six numbers separated by spaces in the following order: center_x center_y center_z size_x size_y size_z.

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If the Definition Method is 'ligand', enter the ligand-ID (as specified in the PDB file) here.

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If the Definition Method is 'detection', enter the detection method here. Allowed: 'dogsitescorer'. Default: dogsitescorer

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If the Definition Method is 'detection', optionally a specific chain-ID can be given here, so that detection is only performed on that chain alone.

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If the Definition Method is 'detection', optionally a specific ligand-ID present in the PDB file can be given here, so that the ligand coverage is also considered in the detection results.

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If the Detection Method is 'dogsitescorer', a selection method should be specified in order to select the best detected binding site. Allowed: 'sorting', 'function'. Default: sorting.

Subject: Binding Site
Description: If the Selection Method is 'function', a valid Python function manipulating the detection results should be entered here. If the Selection Method is 'sorting', a list of binding-site properties to sort the detected binding-sites should be entered here. For more details see the Supplementary Information chapter of the notebook. Default for 'sorting': lig_cov, poc_cov. Default for 'function': (df['drugScore'] + df['simpleScore']) / df['volume'].

Subject: Ligand Similarity Search
Description: Search engine used for the similarity search. Allowed: 'pubchem'. Default: pubchem

Subject: Ligand Similarity Search
Description: Threshold of similarity (in percent) for finding analogs. Default: 80

Subject: Ligand Similarity Search
Description: Maximum number of analogs to retrieve from the similarity search. Default: 100

Subject: Ligand Similarity Search
Property: Maximum Number of Most Drug-Like Analogs to Continue With
Description: Maximum number of analogs with highest drug-likeness to perform docking on. Default: 30

Subject: Docking
Description: The docking program to use. Allowed: 'smina'. Default: smina

Subject: Docking
Property: Number of Docking Poses per Ligand
Description: Number of docking poses to generate for each ligand. Default: 5

Subject: Docking
Description: Exhaustiveness for sampling the conformation space of ligand. Default: 10

Subject: Docking
Description: Random seed for the docking algorithm to make the results deterministic. Default: None

Subject: Interaction Analysis
Description: The program to use for protein-ligand interaction analysis. Allowed: 'plip'. Default: plip

Subject: Optimized Ligand
Description: Number of optimized ligands to output at the end. Default: 1

Subject: Optimized Ligand
Description: Method to select the best optimized ligand(s). Allowed: 'sorting', 'function'. Default: sorting

Subject: Optimized Ligand
Description: If the Selection Method is 'function', a valid Python function manipulating the parameters should be entered here. If the Selection Method is 'sorting', a list of parameters to sort the optimized ligands should be entered here. Allowed parameters are: 'affinity', 'h_bond', 'hydrophobic', 'salt_bridge', 'water_bridge', 'pi_stacking', 'pi_cation', 'halogen', 'metal', 'total_num_interactions', 'drug_score_total'. Default: affinity, total_num_interactions, drug_score_total. For more details see the Supplementary Information chapter of the notebook.
